title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The graph of <math alttext="y equals, f of x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals, f double prime of x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€³</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis, and the numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins on the y axis, slightly below the origin, and moves gradually upward and to the right, leveling off as it approaches the x axis, passed the point where x equals 1. The graph has its steepest slope at a point approximately three fourths of the way between the origin and x equals 1.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis, and the numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins on the y axis, approximately midway between the origin and y equals 1. It curves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis approximately three fourths of the way between the origin and x equals 1. At a point slightly to the right of x equals 1, the graph levels off then moves gradually upward and to the right, and becoming slightly less steep as it approaches the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis, and the numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and curves steeply downward and to the right, until it levels off at a point approximately half of the way between the origin and x equals 1. At this point, the graph moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis slightly to the right of x equals 1. The graph levels off and turns slightly downward ending at a point above the x axis at x equals 2.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis, and the numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and curves steeply upward and to the right, until it levels off at a point approximately half of the way between the origin and x equals 1. At this point, the graph moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis slightly to the right of x equals 1. The graph levels off and turns slightly upward ending at a point below the x axis at x equals 2.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis, and the numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and curves steeply downward and to the right, until it levels off at a point approximately half of the way between the origin and x equals 1. At this point, the graph moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis slightly to the right of x equals 1. The graph levels off and turns slightly downward ending at a point above the x axis at x equals 2.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
